intro: Silene manissadjianii, commonly known as the Armenian campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its simple, hairy stems and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Silene manissadjianii is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
